title: Narrative in TV: How to Find the Right Tone and Style
description: This article provides tips for finding the right tone and style for TV narratives. It covers topics such as selling what you can achieve, using a third party to provide the "who cares" factor, asking questions that don't guide the answer, discovering mutually, encapsulating the story in a 5-second question, telling both sides of the story, reaffirming the case, using a memorable shot to close the report, and following up with those involved.
